answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.Your symptoms of nasal congestion and the forehead pain could be due to sinusitis. Your other symptoms could be due to metabolic disorders like Diabetes Mellitus and Hypothyroidism. A simple blood test could help detect diabetes and hypothyroidism. Please discuss this with your doctor am sure he will provide further assistance.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: For the past 3-4 months, I've had the following symptoms:- Nasal Congestion with no nasal discharge, this is pretty much constant. It only abates when I exercise or take antihistamines/nasal sprays.- A sort of pressure over my face, primarily the forehead. I don't really know how to describe it, but something like a dull pain, perhaps. Rarely in the mornings, appears during the day and gets worse in the evening.- Cold hands and feet, but the hands are considerably colder. Varies in intensity but I am almost always cold. At its worst, washing my hands with even slightly warm water feels like putting my hands in a boiling pot.- At times I feel really, really hungry, despite having eaten recently. I'm not starving myself either, as I've started eating more since this began.- Constantly fatigued, trouble trying to focus at times.- Shortness of breath. Not to the point where I notice it all the time, but definitely when I'm exercising.- Mild, occasional diarrhea- Occasional bloated feeling and trouble properly emptying my bladder (resulting in having to go to the bathroom frequently, particularly when I try to sleep).- Moderate muscle and joint aches.- My throat isn't what I'd call sore but at times it... feels like there's something there. During those times it's harder for me to swallow.- At times I get a mild skin rash over my chest which disappears in an hour or two and re-appears on a daily basis.I've been to both a general practitioner and an ENT. The first time, the GP diagnosed me with sinusitis, I got some antibiotics for it which didn't help with my symptoms, so I went again. He concluded that my sinusitis had gone away and that the symptoms would get better. They didn't, so I went to an ENT who gave me some more antibiotics (didn't work) and ordered a blood test for me. According to him, the blood test showed nothing abnormal... but my symptoms aren't getting any better at all.
title: Nasal congestion, cold hands, fatigue. Any ideas?
